text:
Taking strong exception to the Centre’s “war-like scenario” claim, Mr. Tuki said the Centre’s report was not correct as it did not consult the State machinery. “I don’t feel it is a correct report. This report is just one sided; the Centre has not consulted the State government nor the district administration. This is a report which has been made by one person. There has been no such situation in the State and [it] won’t ever take place,” he added.

In a series of tweets, Mr. Sinha took a jibe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s “great advisers” wondering what answers they would have if the Supreme Court ruled against it. “I have tremendous faith in our dashing, dynamic action hero PM. But wonder who the ‘great’ advisors are who advised President’s Rule in Arunachal Pradesh. That too when the matter is sub judice, in the Supreme Court, under a 5 judge constitutional bench. Wonder what was the hurry and worry.”

“God forbid, if the decision does not go in our favour, wonder what explanation and answer we will have for our respected PM,” he said.
title: Centre acted in haste, says Shatrughan
